DynamicURL.description:
Optional URL configuration at the actor level. Supports dynamic URLs. 
- Max length: 255.

Id.description: Unique ID of the actor (merchant) as defined in the Nayax backoffice.

MCC.description: Merchant Category Code (MCC), classifies businesses by type of goods or services provided.

MerchantId.description:
Merchant identifier as defined in the Nayax backoffice. Contact Nayax to configure. 
- Max length: 255.

Name.description: Merchant name as registered in the Nayax backoffice. Max length: 255.

OperatorId.description: ID of the operator associated with the merchant. Max length: 255.

OperatorName.description: Name of the operator associated with the merchant. Max length: 255.

SubMerchantId.description: Identifier for a sub-merchant under the main merchant. Contact Nayax to configure. Max length: 255.

ActorOnboardingData.description: Echo and/or Updated onboarding actor data (Merchant data)

RegularCredit.description: Regular Credit amount or amounts of transactions based on RegularCreditType.

RevalueCredit.description:
Revalue credit amount.
- Only if card is configured a revalue-able

AgeLimitation.description: Minimum age required for transaction approval.

Amount.description: Transaction amount. Use decimal format (e.g. 0.01 for 1 cent). Currencies without decimal places should also be expressed as a double (e.g. 234.0).

BillingProviderId.description: ID of the billing provider (assigned by Nayax).

CurrencyCode.description: ISO 4217 currency code in Alpha-3 format (e.g. USD, EUR, ILS).

CurrencyNumeric.description: ISO 4217 currency code in Numeric-3 format.

IsDeferredAuthorization.description: Indicates whether the authorization is deferred.

IsProductSelected.description: Indicates whether a product was pre-selected before payment.

IsSoftDeclineCompletion.description: Indicates whether the transaction was completed after a soft decline.

NayaxRRN.description: Reference number for external identification. Should be visible to the end-user or external parties (e.g. card issuer, app provider). Echoed in `/Inquiry` requests.

NayaxTransactionId.description: Internal Nayax ID used to track the transaction in future requests.

PaymentMethodID.description: ID of the payment method provider (assigned by Nayax).

SiteId.description: Region identifier for the Nayax server.

TransactionId.description:
Unique identifier for the transaction.
- If `/StartSession` was used, this echoes the encrypted transaction ID (`TranIDCipher`).
- If not, the Nayax engine generates this value.

AddToBatch.description: Denote on whether to add to the batch

BatchId.description: Batch id relevant to the transaction

BatchTransactionId.description: The transaction id inside the batch (id)

DeleteFromBatch.description: Denote on whether to delete from batch

BatchStatus.description:
*  0 - Missing
*  1 - Open
*  2 - InProgress
*  3 - Close
*  4 - Reopen
*  5 - Closed
*  6 - Declined
* 99 - Unknown

CardData.description: Additional data we read from the card (EMV data, expiration date, cvv2, etc.)

CardNumber.description:
- String ()
- Mandatory
- For card present Authorization and Sale, the full Track2 will be sent in this field.
- For card not present, Settlement, Cancel, Void, Refund - The card PAN only will be sent.

EMVData.description: String of emv tags in TLV format

EntryMode.description:
String (4)
Mandatory
Optional Value:
* MCR - Card number read from the card magnetic stripe.
* CON - Card details read from the chip via the contact interface (insert).
* CLS - Card details read from the chip via the contactless interface (tap).
* NFC - Card details read from the phone via the contactless interface (phone tap).
* CLM - Card track2 read from the chip via the contactless interface (contactless magstripe\\legacy mode).
* MIF\\MIFH - MIFARE\\MIFARE received as Hexadecimal
* QR - Card number read from a QR by the [DOT](https://www.nayax.com/solution/dot/)

Other values may also be sent in specific edge case, for more information please consult your Nayax POC.

ExpMonth.description: Conditional only when Interface is 1 or 10, (MM)

ExpYear.description: Conditional only when Interface is 1 or 10, (YY)

IsDebitCard.description: Indication if card is Debit or Prepaid

Alpha2Code.description:
String(2)
Mandatory
ISO-3166-1 format: Alpha-2 code

Alpha3Code.description:
String(3)
Mandatory
ISO-3166-1 format: Alpha-3 code

Intra.description:
String
Mandatory
An Intra Region refers to a geographical diversification across countries within a single 'Intra region'.
E.g. 'France' is country within the 'European Union' Intra Region.

NumericCode.description:
String(3)
Mandatory
ISO-3166-1 format: Numeric-3 code

ZmkId.description: - Internal ID for the ZMK Key

ZpkId.description: - Internal ID for the ZPK Key

CustomData.description: Custom Fields Information, Contact Nayax TPOC to define.

Actor.description: Actor custom data (String in json format)

DirectActor.description: Direct actor custom data (String in json format)

Distributor.description: Distributor custom data (String in json format)

Machine.description: Machine custom data (String in json format)

Operator.description: Operator custom data (String in json format)

SoftDecline.description: Soft Decline custom data (String in json format)

DenyListIndication.description:
* 0 - unknown/ no effect
* 1 - Decline will cause consumer to be added to the deny list
* 2 - Approval shall cause the consumer to be removed from deny list.

DeviceInfo.description: Hardware and firmware information of the Nayax device.

FWVersion.description: Firmware version installed on the device.

HwSerial.description: Hardware serial number of the Nayax device.

Type.description: Device type as defined in the Nayax system.

DukptInfo.description: Contains encryption details using the DUKPT (Derived Unique Key Per Transaction) method.

KSN.description: Key serial number used for DUKPT encryption.

PINBlock.description: Encrypted PIN data provided by the cardholder. Encrypted using the key received from the TMS.

Status.description:
Use 993 to keep polling.
See status description for more info

ChannelId.description:
- Conditional, for Multi-channel integration, Contact Nayax TPOC to define.
- Channel Values shall be provided by Nayax, and cannot be altered.

ReasonCode.description:
- Optional
- length: Short integer (16)
- Refund reason code as saved in Nayax system

ReasonText.description:
- Optional
- length: 64
- Refund description as saved in Nayax system

ReasonCode.description:
- Optional
- length: Short integer (16)
- Refund reason code as saved in Nayax system

ReasonText.description:
- Optional
- length: 64
- Refund description as saved in Nayax system

ECIType.description:
Electronic Commerce Indicator (ECI), used to identify the type of transaction authentication performed.
Only applicable when `interface = 01`.
Possible values: - `1`  Mail Order/Telephone Order (MOTO), no 3DS - `5`  Fully authenticated CAVV/UCAFF verification - `6`  Attempted authentication at a 3DS-capable merchant (proof of attempt) - `7`  Non-authenticated e-commerce transaction

ECom3DSInfo.description: Contains 3-D Secure (3DS) data used for Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) in electronic commerce transactions.

ECom3DSCallbackUrl.description: URL for receiving the callback from the acquirer.

ECom3DSRequested.description: Indicates whether SCA verification is requested for this transaction.

ECom3DSUCAFFCAVV.description: Base64-encoded authentication value (CAVV/UCAFF). Required only if `ECI = 05`.

ECom3DSVersion.description: Specifies the supported 3DS version. Typically set to `1`.

XID.description: Base64-encoded transaction ID used in 3DS authentication.

ECom3DSRedirectUrl.description: where the requester should redirect the customer for the SCA verification

ECom3DSStatus.description:
Conditional - when ECom3DSRequested was true.
  * 0/null/missing - no 3DS attempted
  * 1 - 3DS attempted & No SCA Required (Frictionless or waived by the issuer)
  * 2 - 3DS attempted - SCA Required (Redirect URL must be used)
  * 3 - 3DS attempt could not be completed with provider
  * 4 - SCA performed and Failed
  * 5 - SCA performed and Completed
  * 6 - SCA could not be completed by Issuer

ECom3DSType.description:
3DS version supported by the merchant:
* 0 - Not supported
* 1 - 3DS version 1.0
* 2 - 3DS version  2.0

EMVTags.description: Response EMV tags, Mandatory for Contact.

Tag71.description: EMV Tag 71 (Issuer Script Template 1). Tags 71 and 72 are optional and in any case should only be sent on Contact flow.

Tag72.description: EMV Tag 72 (Issuer Script Template 2). Tags 71 and 72 are optional and in any case should only be sent on Contact flow.

Tag8A.description: EMV Tag 8A (Authorisation Response Code), Mandatory for Contact. Value must be sent in ASCII value, e.g.value of 00 (HEXA) should be sent as 3030 (ASCII) and value of 05 (HEXA) should be sent as 3035 .

Tag91.description: EMV Tag 91 (Issuer Authentication Data), Mandatory for Contact.

EncryptInfo.description: Contains encryption metadata used for secure transmission.

CertificateFileName.description: Name of the certificate file used for encryption (filename only, without path).

EncryptedSessionKey.description: AES session key encrypted with the recipient's public key.

RandomNumber.description: Random number generated for encryption operations.

FreeInfo.description:
- This field is relevant only to certain integrations
- Please contact our integration team for further assistance

GeoLocation.description: Actor and Machine Geo location information

Address.description:
String(255)
Optional
Address as defined in the Nayax backoffice

City.description:
- String(255)
- Optional
- City as defined in the Nayax backoffice

CountryCode.description:
String
Optional
Country code (ISO3) as defined in the Nayax backoffice

Latitude.description: - Machine Location Latitude as defined in the Nayax backoffice

Longitude.description: - Machine Location Longitude as defined in the Nayax backoffice

State.description:
- String
- Optional
- Actor geo state code as defined in the Nayax backoffice

ZipCode.description:
String(255)
Optional
Zip code defined in the Nayax backoffice

MachineInfo.description: Information about the machine involved in the transaction.

City.description: City where the machine is located, as defined in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 255 characters.

DecimalPlace.description:
Number of decimal places for transaction amounts.
- For example, `2` means values like 123.45. - A value of `0` means 12345 (no decimal).

ExternalId.description: External machine ID as provided by the operator in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 200 characters.

Id.description: Unique machine ID as allocated in the Nayax backoffice.

Name.description: Machine name as defined in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 255 characters.

Offset.description: UTC timezone offset. Maximum length: 255 characters.

OperatorId.description: Merchant ID as defined in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 255 characters.

Region.description: Region assigned to the machine in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 255 characters.

TerminalId.description: Optional terminal identifier defined in the Nayax backoffice. Contact Nayax TPOC to configure. Maximum length: 255 characters.

Type.description: Machine type as defined in the Nayax backoffice. Maximum length: 50 characters.

ZipCode.description: Zip or postal code for the machine location. Maximum length: 255 characters.

MachineOnboardingData.description: Echo and/or Updated onboarding machine data

Kcv.description: - New Key Check value (content is bytes)

Code.description:
Indicates the onboarding status:
    0 - Null-none
    1 - Pending
    2 - Success
    3 - Failed
    4 - Expired
    5 - Skip
 - enum
 - Mandatory
 - Indicates the onboarding status.

StatusMessage.description:
- Optional
- Length: 255
- Onboarding status message free text field / additional varying data

Verdict.description:
- Mandatory
- Const string values:
- Status of the request ('Approved'/'Declined')

OnboardingOperation.description:
Indicates the possible onboarding operation:
    1 - Register
    2 - Unregister
    3 - Update
    4 - GetStatus
 - enum
 - Mandatory
 - Indicates the possible onboarding operation.

RequestTime.description:
- Mandatory
- The date time string of when the Onboarding took place
- Format: ddMMyyHHmmss

TransactionID.description:
- Mandatory
- Generated by the integrator on startSession

OnboardingStatusEnum.description:
* 0 - None
* 1 - Pending
* 2 - Success
* 3 - Failed
* 4 - Expired
* 5 - Skip

Balance.description:
Type of Balance object
Optional Pre-Paid balance details

Type of Balance object

PosDisplay.description:
In this feature, MOL will have the ability to send Nayax two strings with free texting
according to the API requirements.

Balance.description:
Type of Balance object
Optional Pre-Paid balance details

Type of Balance object
Optional Pre-Paid balance details

PaymentInfo.description:
Identifies transaction information and references. Included in all response messages for payment calls.
When used in requests (e.g. `/Settlement`, `/Void`, `/Refund`, `/Inquiry`), this object should match the `PaymentInfo` returned in a previous call.

SrvTranId.description: Integrator's internal transaction ID. Use only if `/StartSession` was not used. If `/StartSession` was used, this should be empty or echo the transaction ID from the request.

AuthCode.description: External authorization code (usually from the card issuer). In dynamic QR, the approval code from the `/Inquiry` response overrides previous values.

AuthAmount.description: Original amount requested in `/Authorization` or `/Sale`. Optional in other cases.

SettAmount.description: Final settled amount, used in `/Settlement`, `/Inquiry`, or `/Sale`. In Cortina External Prepaid, this may reflect a discounted amount and is used for reporting only.

RRN.description: Reference Retrieval Number. Should be visible to the cardholder and match the one in the `/GenerateQR` response.

Token.description: Unique token for the transaction. For internal Nayax use only.

AuthDateTime.description: Date and time of the `/Authorization` or `/Sale`. Format: `ddMMyyHHmmss`

SettDateTime.description: Date and time of the `/Settlement` or `/Sale`. Format: `ddMMyyHHmmss`

TraceNumber.description: Trace number. For internal Nayax use only.

AdditionalData.description: Optional custom data in JSON format. Contact Nayax to configure.

IsGatewayTimeout.description: Indicates whether there was a gateway timeout.

ProviderExternalData.description: External data from provider in JSON format.

InitiateTranReference.description: References the original Nayax transaction ID when reattempting a prepaid loyalty card transaction.

IsRevalueCard.description: Indicates whether the card supports revalue.

IsLastPolling.description: Flag indicator of last polling attempt

Product.description: Details of the product selected in the transaction.

CatalogProductId.description: External unique identifier of the product (catalog number) as defined in the Nayax backoffice.

Code.description: Numeric code of the product, as defined in the Nayax backoffice or vending machine.

Group.description: Product group name as defined in the product map.

Measurement.description: Quantity of the product in the specified unit of measurement.

Name.description: Product name as defined in the Nayax backoffice.

Price.description: Product price in the machines currency. This is the base price before adjustments (e.g. surcharges or loyalty discounts).

ProductGroupId.description: Code of the product group as defined in the product map.

PulseLineNumber.description: Line number used for remote vend via pulse. Must be a non-negative integer.

UnitOfMeasurement.description: Unit of measurement for the product (e.g. "unit", "liter").

ChannelId.description:
- Conditional for multi channel integrations
- Echo of the value provided by Nayax in the request.

RRN.description:
- Mandatory
- Reference Retrieval Number, Used as External Transaction Identification for external parties (Usually Card schemes, or App service providers).From support perspective - It is highly recommended that this ID shall be the one visible to the end consumer/Card holder and the card's Issuer (e.g. Bank) or Application service provider (e.g. Alipay, WeChat). If none of the above is applicable, the Integrator shall generate an additional String.
- This Value shall be echoed in the `/Inquiry` request.

SrvTranId.description:
- the Integrator's internal transaction id.
- Conditional, only if /StartSession was **not** Used.
- If /StartSession was used, this should be either empty or Echo the Transaction ID sent in the request.

ResponseCode.description:
Error description
*   -9 - Onboarding Failure
*   0 - Success
*   4 - Insufficient funds
*   5 - Onboarding Success
*   8 - Onboarding In Progress
* 80 - AgeVerification approved
* 81 - AgeVerification declined
* 82 - AgeVerification data not available on client side (For ex. card not recognized)
* 83 - AgeVerification provider not responding
* 84 - AgeVerification data invalid (The requested age cannot be verified because it does not match any age group)
* 85 - AgeVerification command data invalid
* 990 - CertificateFileName not found
* 991 - Failed to decipher message body
* 992 - Timeout
* 993 - Keep polling
* 994 - Card Brand Not supported
* 995 - Device Skip Site
* 996 - Transaction ID unknown / Duplicate Transaction ID (Start Session Error)
* 997 - Missing mandatory parameters
* 998 - Validation/request cannot be parsed
* 999 - General system failure
* 1010 - Public Key Certificate not found
* 1011 - Method not Implemented
* 1021 - Switch Interface

EntryMode.description:
String (4)
Mandatory
Optional Value:
* MCR - Card number read from the card magnetic stripe.
* CON - Card details read from the chip via the contact interface (insert).

RevaluePaymentInfo.description: - This Object Identifies Revalue Transaction Information and references (RRNs,Transaction IDs, AUth Code, original amounts etc..)

AdditionalData.description:
- Optional, Contact Nayax TPOC on order define.
- String in JSON format.

IsGatewayTimeout.description: Was there was a gateway timeout (valid in response)

RRN.description:
Reference Retrieval Number, Used as External Transaction Identification for external parties (Usually Card schemes)
From support perspective - It is highly recommended that this ID shall be the one visible to the end consumer/Card holder.

RevalueAmount.description: - The original amount requested in /Revalue requested.

RevalueDateTime.description:
- The date time string of when the /Revalue took place
- Format: ddMMyyHHmmss

DynamicURL.description:
- Optional, support different url's.
- Length: 255
- Actor level url configuration

- Optional, support different url's.
- Length: 255
- Actor level url configuration

RandomNumber.description: Nayax will create 27 char Random Number

TranIDCipher.description:
- Mandatory
- The Integrator Generates transaction ID of 36 Chars (or 288 bits).
- The Integrator then appends the char = and RandomNumber to create the ciphertext of 64 chars
- Format TransactionId=RandomNumber
- The integrator encrypts the ciphertexts with the Secret Token in AES ECB.
- The AES key will be the last (right most) 256 bits (or 32 chars) of the Secret Token the matches the TokenID provided in the request.
- Nayax will AES ECB decrypt and extract transaction id
- The transaction Id value will then be used for all further requests

ReasonCode.description:
- Optional
- Cancellation reason code (by nayax system table of error codes)

ReasonText.description:
- Optional
- Length: 255
- Cancellation reason description (by nayax system table of error codes)

AppUserId.description:
- Mandatory
- Length: 40
- Unique identifier of the consumer in Mobile App provider system

Balance.description:
- Optional
- Decimal (max 3 digits for cents)
- The balance of user's account.

Data.description: - Data received from a third party and will be sent back in response

SecretToken.description:
- Mandatory
- Length: 64
- Unique key for the your system.
This value will be Provided by Nayax in advance.
You should keep this value as a secret in your system.

TerminalId.description:
- Conditional, must be sent if UniQR is not sent.
- Length: 255
- Unique Identifier for the vending machine printed on a
sticker or encoded in the QR (HW-Serial of the device)

TransactionId.description:
- Mandatory
- Length: 40
- Unique identifier for the transaction which will be echoed
in further requests and responses. Minimum of 8 chars.

UniQR.description:
- Conditional, must be sent if TerminalId is not sent.
- Machine reference unique qr number

ReasonCode.description:
- Optional
- Refund reason code (by nayax system table of error codes)

ReasonText.description:
- Optional
- Length: 255
- Refund reason description (by nayax system table of error codes)

ReasonCode.description:
- Optional
- Cancellation reason code (by nayax system table of error codes)

ReasonText.description:
- Optional
- Length: 255
- Cancellation reason description (by nayax system table of error codes)

Code.description:
- Conditional - Only if verdict value is declined
- Please refer to the Decline Reasons Code List in the relevant Overview section for full list of allowed decline codes

CustomDeclineCode.description:
- Optional
- This field is used for specifying a custom decline code (i.e. Soft Decline or Switch Interface).
- The value might be the same as the acquirer's response code or composed by other data.

StatusMessage.description:
- Optional
- Length: 255
- Transaction status message free text field / additional varying data

Verdict.description:
- Mandatory
- Const string values:
- Status of the request ('Approved'/'Declined')

TransitTransactionType.description:
* 1 - Prefunded
* 2 - Realtime Authorization
* 3 - Post-Authorization Aggregated Transaction
* 7 - Debt Recovery

info.description: Credit Card, Prepaid, DynamicQR, StaticQR APIs
info.title: Nayax Cortina API

post.description: Cortina Age Verification
This endpoint is used to initiate a Pre-authorization transaction on the customer's credit card. Ensuring that the credit card is valid and has sufficient balance to process the transaction.
Cancels an authorized but uncompleted transaction.
This endpoint allows for additional funds to be authorized on a previously approved transaction.
Checks the 3D Secure status of a transaction to verify the cardholders identity.
This endpoint is used to return funds to a customers credit card after a transaction has been completed.
Processes a complete transaction, combining authorization and settlement into a single request.
This endpoint is used to finalize an approved transaction.
Allows to reverse an authorized transaction that has not yet been settled.

This method is called by Nayax and provides the integrator with a transaction Id identification (Generated in /StartSession),
required Amount, merchant, and Machine details (and more). The integrator Shall validate the information and respond
with the Dynamic QR information to be displayed on the Nayax device accordingly.

This method is called by Nayax to inquire the approval status of a Transaction ID.
This call will include the transaction's final amount and the transaction ID generated in the `/GenerateQR` call.
An Approved response this call will usually attempt to vend/release the product.
A Decline will terminate the transaction and a Pending response will trigger a subsequent `/Inquiry` request after a predefined time.
Consult your Technical Point of Contact in Nayax to setup how many calls and how frequently should they be polled.

This method is called by Nayax, within Nayax web system (DCS),
to refund full/partial amount of the sale`/Settlement` payment requests or a successful inquiry,
for example due to an Application user's complaint.

This method is called by Nayax to void a previously successful Inquiry payment requests (for example- in cases where product was not dispensed,
or the machine has been timed-out).
In some cases, this command may resemble the effect of /Refund (in pre-selection cases) method. However,
the /Void method should always be implemented nevertheless as it refers to a dedicated user story.
Cortina Prepaid Authorization
Cortina Prepaid Cancel
Cortina Prepaid Refund
Cortina Prepaid Sale
Cortina Prepaid Settlement
Cortina Prepaid Void

## Renew Key
Nayax Engine takes the key as is and asks the Provider MS to refresh the key (step 3)
Cortina returns new PIN encryption key (step 4) under the ZMK of the provider
[![Renew Key Process](Redoc/CortinaMain/RenewKeyProcess.png)](Redoc/CortinaMain/RenewKeyProcess.png)
Optional method, Notify Sale Success, this method is called by Nayax to inform the integrator about a successful end of sale transaction.
Initial Request Validation

Used in preauthorization cases (e.g., when a consumer starts a transaction, but the exact clearing amount will be defined later according to their uses),
this method is called by Nayax and provides the integrator with relevant information to validate and authorize an ongoing transaction by the consumer based on their account.
/Authorization request will temporarily hold credit in the consumer account balance as part of the transaction flows. This command must be followed by either settlement or cancel request.

In events of revoking preauthorization process, this method is called by Nayax and provides the integrator with relevant information to revoke an ongoing instance of preauthorization transaction.
Therefore, in such events this method (Cancel) will replace the settlement method and will release the temporarily captured credit in the consumer account.
for example, in event such of Vend fail, authorization timeout, consumer manual cancels before choosing a product.

This method is called by Nayax, within Nayax web system (DCS), to refund full/partial amount of the sale`/Settlement` payment requests or a successful inquiry, for example due to an Application user's complaint.

Used in preselection cases (e.g., when a consumer starts a transaction, and the exact clearing amount is known),
this method is called by Nayax and provides the integrator with relevant information to charge the consumer account balance for a specific amount in a single request.

Upon successful dispense of a product/service by the operator's machine, Nayax will call this method to complete and capture the transaction with the integrator.
This call will include the transaction's final amount to be cleared by the integrator.

This method is called by Nayax to void a previously successful payment request.
For example, in cases such as vend failed, Cortina time out in `/Sale` method, and device failed to produce settlement after a successful `/Sale`.
Although in pre-selection cases /Void may resemble to /Refund method, /Void should always be implemented as it addresses different use cases.

get.description: Returns the Cortina assembly version and build

post.description:
This method starts every transaction flow and informs Nayax that a consumer has been approached to an operator's machine.
This method is called by the Integrator and provides Nayax with a transaction Id (Generated by the integrator and binds all Nayax-Integrator communication regarding a certain transaction),
AppUserID, TerminalId, secret token, and App account balance.

The request should be sent to the following address:
https://lynx.nayax.com/payment/v2/transactions/cortina/(integrator's payment method name)/start
Onboard Actor
Onboard Machine

get.description: Returns the Commerce assembly version and build

domain.description: Customer ID assigned by the service provider
